content.description: The easier version of Fake Snakes V3, which uses the rails at the beginning that are off for that one. Off the same starting jug, move up to the rail rather than staying low. (So you’ll be have hands and feet above the lip from the get-go, which you will not on Fake Snakes.) Don’t top out straight up — traverse all the way to the obvious horn jug on the far right and top out there (same as Fake Snakes). I’ve heard V0, but I'll disagree on that — unless I completely missed some magical jug in the middle that makes this trivial. There’s a reasonable span off a sloper that a V1 climber would still have some difficulty with. And, now I think about it, the topout is probably a bit more than V0 too, even though it’s juggy.NOTE: other guide says this is called "Earthworms" and I was told that that name is incorrect.
content.protection: Couple pads, or just step off if you think you might fall
content.location: Exactly where Fake Snakes is, using all the same holds plus a few extras

content.description:
Overhung with gym-like holds. The beginning is slightly contrived because there's a rail within reach that is supposedly 'off'.

 Very fun!
content.location: Bushwack up the hill from Ice Cube Boulder. 41.453926, -73.617582

content.description: Home to a few nice lines!
